channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Timeline of New Zealand's newest Covid-19 community transmission cluster
item.description: This timeline charts the movements of New Zealand's newest Covid-19 cluster, the actions of health authorities and the government response.

item.title: Live: Auckland enters second day at alert level 3, rest of NZ at level 2
item.description: Hoteliers are fielding thousands of cancellation calls, the NZ Hotel Owners Association says, and it is "beyond grim" for an already struggling sector.

item.title: New Zealand scientists lead largest Weddell Sea survey
item.description: The survey of sea ice aims to understand impacts of climate change on crabeater seals.

item.title: Mental health study on young people shows they don't feel heard
item.description: A new study is shedding light on the state of mental health and wellbeing among New Zealand youth - which is continuing to deteriorate.

item.title: Covid-19 testing in Auckland breaks previous single-day record
item.description: Nearly 8000 people were tested for the coronavirus in Auckland yesterday, smashing the previous record of 6400 on 24 June.

item.title: NZTA leaked report reveals high-level failings, conflicts of interest
item.description: A leaked report has revealed serious, high-level failings in how the Transport Agency awarded major IT contracts.

item.title: Covid-19 update: 13 new cases in community, one in managed isolation
item.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern says there is more information needed to find the source of the Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: Covid-19: More hours-long queues for testing, travel in Auckland
item.description: Auckland residents have been queuing up again in droves around testing centres today on day two of the level 3 lockdown.

item.title: Hotels inundated with mass cancellations following return to higher Covid-19 alert levels
item.description: The accommodation sector was already struggling after the borders closed and lockdown, with significant staff losses, hotels being mothballed or running with single-digit occupancies.

item.title: DOC dismisses fears seals' deaths are sinister
item.description: The Department of Conservation says a number of seal deaths in Kaikōura are not suspicious. Warning: story contains a distressing image.

item.title: Ngapaki Gripp's lawyer denies murder-accused was 'cold-blooded, calculating'
item.description: Gripp's lawyer Mike Antunovic told the jury in closing statements today Gripp was protecting himself and his younger cousin.

item.title: Covid-19: Imported goods as outbreak source an unlikely theory - Professor David Murdoch
item.description: One of the countries top infectious disease specialists says it's unlikely the Covid-19 outbreak in Auckland originated from imported goods.

item.title: Experts Michael Baker and Shaun Hendy share concerns Auckland outbreak could be 'generations' deep
item.description: Covid-19 could have been spreading in Auckland for weeks, with dozens of people already infected, two experts claim.

item.title: Auckland at alert level 3: Police turn away people trying to visit friends or go to holiday homes
item.description: Every vehicle that comes in and out of the city is being checked after Auckland went into Covid-19 alert level 3 lockdown yesterday.

item.title: Covid-19: Americold confirms three new co-workers return positive results
item.description: Three new Covid-19 cases linked to the Americold worker who tested positive earlier this week have been confirmed by the company.

item.title: Police add almost 1300 officers to ranks, but fall short of 1800 target
item.description: The government has failed to meet its target of increasing the total number of police by 1800 officers in three years. But there are 1280 more officers than this time three years ago.

item.title: Quarter-million children home from school in Auckland under Covid-19 alert level 3
item.description: Auckland principals say they are well-prepared for a return to home learning this week, but with about 250,000 at home, schools warns some children will fall behind.

item.title: Covid-19: Mount Albert Grammar student tests positive, close contact of existing South Auckland cases
item.description: A Mount Albert Grammar student in Auckland who tested positive for Covid-19 was a close contact of the four existing South Auckland cases.
